heisig_story: The first companion that God made, as the Bible story goes, was Eve. Upon seeing her, Adam exclaimed, "Flesh of my flesh!" And that is precisely what this character says in so many strokes.

origin_of_ch_char_book: The ancient Chinese used seashells not just for currency, but also to wear around the neck as an ornament. (æœ‹, peng=pâ€™eng, friend) shows two lines of seashells. People used to carry seashells strung together like these because they were esier to carry that way. The appearance of two lines side by side seem like friends, leading this word to mean â€œfriendâ€.
humanum_full_description_en:
Two strings of shellfish tied with ropes on a golden inscription elephant. The Yin and Shang Dynasty took jade and shellfish as their currency, and used things to run through them. The second-line jade is a "ç¨", and the second-line shell is a " friend ". (Wang Guowei) The unit of measurement used in Jia Jinwen. Such as "Collection" 29694: "Bei Shipeng." He Zun: "Yi (given) Bei 30peng." Qiu Weiyan: "Eighty friends."

Guo Moruo believes that the ancients first used shells as necklaces, and later evolved into currency. Therefore, Pombe may have no definite number, because the ancients used Pombe as a neck ornament at the beginning, and the length can be as long as it is suitable. Can prepare a word.

The Jiajin inscriptions also have the form of " Peng " and " Ren ", and scholars often refer to it as "å€—". Next to the " person " is written "å‹¹" in the bronze inscription, as if leaning over a human form. This glyph is used in bronze inscriptions to express the meaning of friend. The character " Peng " in regular script evolved from this glyph. (Huang Wenjie) See "å€—".

Xu Shen believes that " Peng " is an ancient prose of " Feng ". "Said Wen": "ğ¢´, ancient phoenix, pictogram. The phoenix flies, the birds count in tens of thousands, so I think it is the word " Peng "." Pressing " Peng " and " Phoenix " is just a phony relationship.

There are also examples in ancient books where " Peng " means the unit of goods, such as "Poems. Xiaoya. "Jingjingzhe": "Since I have seen a gentleman, I have a hundred friends." "Huainanzi. "Tao Ying": "So Sanyisheng is to seek the treasures of the world with thousands of dollars, to obtain the treasures, the multiplication of the chickens, the profound jade, the big shells, the black leopard, the yellow ç½´, the green çŠ´, and the white tiger text. To dedicate to Zhou."

" Peng " mostly means friends and like-minded people. Such as "Tsinghua One. "Cheng Mao" Jane 4: "Ke (He) respects (police) non-friends, Ke (He) refrains from non-commercials." It means to use friends as police and the Shang dynasty as a warning. Another example is "The Analects. "Xue Er": "Is it a pleasure to have friends from afar?"

" Peng " also means being in a group or party. Such as "Shan Hai Jing. "Bei Shan Jing": "There are birds Yan, who live in groups and fly with friends, and their hair is like a female pheasant, and the name is éµ." "Chu Ci. "Li Sao": "While living at the same time and good friends, the husband He Yan will not listen."

" Peng " also means to share together. Such as "Hou Han Shu. "Li Du Biography": "Lee and Du are in the same position as friends." Li Xian's note: "Friends are the same."

Two strings of shellfish tied with ropes on a golden inscription elephant. The Yin and Shang Dynasty took jade and shellfish as their currency, and used things to run through them. The second-line jade is a " ç¨", and the second-line shell is a " friend". (Wang Guowei) The unit of measurement used in Jia Jinwen. Such as "Collection" 29694: "Bei Shipeng." He Zun: "Yi (given) Bei 30peng." Qiu Weiyan: "Eighty friends." Guo Moruo believes that the ancients first used shells as necklaces, and later evolved into currency. Therefore, Pombe may have no definite number, because the ancients used Pombe as a neck ornament at the beginning, and the length can be as long as it is suitable. Can prepare a word. The Jiajin inscriptions also have the form of " Peng" and " Ren", and scholars often refer to it as " å€—". Next to the " person" is written " å‹¹" in the bronze inscription, as if leaning over a human form. This glyph is used in bronze inscriptions to express the meaning of friend. The character " Peng" in regular script evolved from this glyph. (Huang Wenjie) See " å€—". Xu Shen believes that " Peng" is an ancient prose of " Feng". "Said Wen": "ğ¢´, ancient phoenix, pictogram. The phoenix flies, the birds count in tens of thousands, so I think it is the word " Peng"." Pressing " Peng" and " Phoenix" is just a phony relationship. There are also examples in ancient books where " Peng" means the unit of goods, such as "Poems. Xiaoya. "Jingjingzhe": "Since I have seen a gentleman, I have a hundred friends." "Huainanzi. "Tao Ying": "So Sanyisheng is to seek the treasures of the world with thousands of dollars, to obtain the treasures, the multiplication of the chickens, the profound jade, the big shells, the black leopard, the yellow ç½´, the green çŠ´, and the white tiger text. To dedicate to Zhou." " Peng" mostly means friends and like-minded people. Such as "Tsinghua One. "Cheng Mao" Jane 4: "Ke (He) respects (police) non-friends, Ke (He) refrains from non-commercials." It means to use friends as police and the Shang dynasty as a warning. Another example is "The Analects. "Xue Er": "Is it a pleasure to have friends from afar?" " Peng" also means being in a group or party. Such as "Shan Hai Jing. "Bei Shan Jing": "There are birds Yan, who live in groups and fly with friends, and their hair is like a female pheasant, and the name is éµ." "Chu Ci. "Li Sao": "While living at the same time and good friends, the husband He Yan will not listen." " Peng" also means to share together. Such as "Hou Han Shu. "Li Du Biography": "Lee and Du are in the same position as friends." Li Xian's note: "Friends are the same."

Basic explanation of words
Friends
pÃ©ng
People who are friendly to each other: friends. Peers. Friends. Friends. Guests and friends. Beloved relatives and friends.
Party formation: crony (a group of people who collude with each other and exclude dissidents for self-interest).
In groups: living in groups and flying with friends.
In ancient times, shells were used as currency, five shells were one string, and two strings were one friend.
Ratio: Hard and no friends.
